text: cockroaches are really fast and
surprisingly squishable you could say
that's the very definition of creepy or
you could ask what if we had a robot
like that researchers at the University
of California Berkeley wanted to see how
good these insects really are they
tested American cockroaches also known
as water bugs they ran them through
smaller and smaller tunnels even when
they were flattened the roaches scuttled
along at almost two feet per second
they have rigid body plates connected by
flexible tissue even when the body is
compressed splayed legs get enough of a
grip to push that body alone awesome
they can take pressure up to 900 times
their body wind and come out unharmed
the researchers used what they found out
to make a palm-sized prototype of a
robot that could get into collapsed
buildings and look for survivors call it
the rescue roach and don't step on it
